YORUBA ANNUAL WORLD HERITAGE CULTURAL FESTIVAL

...celebrating our cultural heirtage

CELEBRATING OUR CULTURAL HERITAGE

About YAWHCF

The Yoruba Annual World Heritage Cultural Festival (YAWHCF) was established to address the diminishing continuity of Yoruba culture, values, norms, and traditions. This unique festival recognizes the growing global embrace of Yoruba culture by diverse races and creeds, while also acknowledging the gradual decline in cultural engagement among the younger generations of the Yoruba people.
YAWHCF aims to rejuvenate and promote our cultural heritage by fostering an environment conducive to the revitalization of our core values and traditions.
It also aims to unite all Yoruba descendant both at home and in the diaspora.
This objective is pursued through a comprehensive program of lectures, symposia, and the dissemination of scholarly white papers.
Spanning a week, YAWHCF serves as a vibrant platform to celebrate and showcase the rich values, language, and cultural practices of the Yoruba people. The festival welcomes individuals from Canada and around the world who identify with the Yoruba community, whether by birth, heritage, marriage, association, or affinity.
